primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Son of God interposes himself between humanity and the fatal power of Sin, undergoing cosmic rejection to transform the human condition.

subject.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Son of God

object.identificatie: Redemption / Radical reorientation of life / Defeat of Sin
tekstueel_bewijs: make the message of the Cross a living and breathing power
it was all in the mind of the triune God from the beginning
displays the truth about what the human race can do
present during these three hours by his Holy Spirit

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / The Human Capacity for Evil / Cosmic Abandonment
tekstueel_bewijs: the capacity of the human race for evil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but a 'fatal power' and 'cosmic drama' that requires the abandonment of the Son of God.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response of attention, awe, and 'making the words their own'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's action is a response to the primary action of Christ.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the 'Pouvoir' (Power) of Christ to effect change, contrasted with the 'Non-Pouvoir' (Inability) of the human imagination or effort.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the 'Generic Religion' (~S1) to the 'Dereliction' (S2) to show that only through S2 is S1 (Grace) achieved.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies the position of S2 (Judgment/Rejection) to move the Receiver to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon focuses on the 'ultimate horror' and 'shameful conduct'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God/Christ is the primary actor in the salvation event, and the human condition is described as one of total inability and depravity.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If we do not grapple... we simply cannot understand.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He interposed himself between us and Sin's fatal power.
Sin's fatal power... cosmic drama... dreadful onslaught.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon explicitly rejects using the Cross as a mere symbol or moral example of suffering.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the unique actor of a unique event.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Awe and realization of own helplessness.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic undertones; salvation is an outside-in event.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative logic is tight: Human sin (Opponent) creates a need that only the Son of God (Subject) can meet through the Cross (Object).
spanning_punten: The tension between human 'rejection' (social) and Christ's 'rejection' (cosmic).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He interposed himself between us and Sin's fatal power.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit makes the message a 'living and breathing power' (Pouvoir).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is a 'fatal power' and 'depravity'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject. It avoids the 'Helper' trap where God merely assists human self-improvement.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (what the Spirit does now).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on how the Spirit 'radically reorients' the life of the hearer today.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (Christ's work) clearly precedes and enables Ethics (reoriented living).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in grace-oriented preaching. The actantial structure ensures that the glory belongs to the Subject (Christ) while the benefit belongs to the Receiver (the church).

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the use of Newsweek or Handel, semiotics reveals the underlying 'engine' is Christ's substitutionary work.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Isaiah; semiotics shows how the preacher 'casts' the hearer as a helpless beneficiary of that prophecy.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that even when the preacher says 'we must understand,' the 'Pouvoir' (ability) to understand is attributed to the Holy Spirit, not human intellect.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'we' primarily in the context of shared human failure or shared reception of grace, avoiding the moralistic 'we must' of performance.
